column2: Execution

column2: There were periods when fear clogged his throat and left him gasping with the need to scream and beat his cell walls.
column3: There were periods when fear clogged his throat and left him gasping with the need to scream and beat his cell walls.

column2: There were also times when it didn't seem to matter, and when his only thoughts were for the villages and the plague.
column3: There were also times when it didn't seem to matter, and when his only thoughts were for the villages and the plague.

column2: They brought him the papers, where he was painted as a monster beside whom Jack the Ripper and Albrecht Delier were gentle amateurs.
column3: They brought him the papers, where he was painted as a monster beside whom Jack the Ripper and Albrecht Delier were gentle amateurs.

column2: They were trying to focus all fear and resentment on him.
column3: They were trying to focus all fear and resentment on him.

column2: Maybe it was working. There were screaming crowds outside the jail, and the noise of their hatred was strong enough to carry through even the atmosphere of Mars. But there were also signs that the Lobby was worried, as if afraid that some attempt might still be made to rescue him.
column3: Maybe it was working. There were screaming crowds outside the jail, and the noise of their hatred was strong enough to carry through even the atmosphere of Mars. But there were also signs that the Lobby was worried, as if afraid that some attempt might still be made to rescue him.

column2: He'd looked forward to the trip to the airport as a way of judging public reaction.

column2: But apparently the Lobby had no desire to test that. The guards led him up to the roof of the jail, where a rocket was waiting.
column3: But apparently the Lobby had no desire to test that. The guards led him up to the roof of the jail, where a rocket was waiting.

column2: The landing space was too small for one of the station shuttles, but a little Northport-Southport shuttle was parked there after what must have been a difficult set-down.
column3: The landing space was too small for one of the station shuttles, but a little Northport Southport shuttle was parked there after what must have been a difficult set down.

column2: The guards tested Doc's manacles and forced him into the shuttle.
column3: The guards tested Doc's manacles and forced him into the shuttle.

column2: Inside, Chris was waiting, carrying an official automatic.
column3: Inside, Chris was waiting, carrying an official automatic.

column2: There was also a young pilot, looking nervous and unhappy.
column3: There was also a young pilot, looking nervous and unhappy.

column2: He was muttering under his breath as the guards locked Doc's legs to a seat and left.
column3: He was muttering under his breath as the guards locked Doc's legs to a seat and left.

column2: All right, Chris ordered.
column3: All right, Chris ordered.

column2: Up ship!
column3: Up ship!

column2: I tell you we're overweight with you.	I tell you we're overweight with you.
I wasn't counting on three for the trip," the pilot protested.
column3: I wasn't counting on three for the trip," the pilot protested.

column2: The only thing that will get this into orbit with the station is faith.	The only thing that will get this into orbit with the station is faith.
I'm loaded with every drop of fuel she'll hold and it still isn't enough."
column3: I'm loaded with every drop of fuel she'll hold and it still isn't enough."

column2: That's your problem, Chris told him firmly.
column3: That's your problem, Chris told him firmly.

column2: You've got your orders, and so have I. Up ship!
column3: You've got your orders, and so have i Up ship!

column2: Chris had never been afraid to do what she felt she should.

column2: The pilot stared at her doubtfully and finally turned back to his controls, still muttering.
column3: The pilot stared at her doubtfully and finally turned back to his controls, still muttering.

column2: The shuttle lifted sluggishly, but there was no great difficulty.
column3: The shuttle lifted sluggishly, but there was no great difficulty.

column2: Doc could see that there was even some fuel remaining when they slipped into the tube at the orbital station.
column3: Doc could see that there was even some fuel remaining when they slipped into the tube at the orbital station.

column2: Chris went out, and other guards came in to free him.
column3: Chris went out, and other guards came in to free him.

column2: So long, Dr. Feldman, the pilot called softly as they led him out. Then the guards shoved him through the airlock into the station.
column3: So long, dr Feldman, the pilot called softly as they led him out. Then the guards shoved him through the airlock into the station.

column2: He grinned wryly.
column3: He grinned wryly.

column2: He roamed the cabin until he found a little collapsible table.
column3: He roamed the cabin until he found a little collapsible table.

column2: He set the electron microscope up on that and plugged it in.
column3: He set the electron microscope up on that and plugged it in.

column2: It seemed a shame that good equipment should be wasted along with his life.
column3: It seemed a shame that good equipment should be wasted along with his life.

column2: He wondered if they would really throw it out into space with him.
column3: He wondered if they would really throw it out into space with him.

column2: Probably they would.
column3: Probably they would.

column2: He pushed a button on the call board over the table and asked for the steward.
column3: He pushed a button on the call board over the table and asked for the steward.

column2: There was a long wait, as if the procedure were being checked with some authority, but finally he received a surly acknowledgement. "Steward.
column3: There was a long wait, as if the procedure were being checked with some authority, but finally he received a surly acknowledgement. "Steward.

column2: How's the chance of getting some food?
column3: How's the chance of getting some food?

column2: You're on first-class.
column3: You're on first-class.

column2: They could afford it, Doc decided.
column3: They could afford it, Doc decided.

column2: He wouldn't cost them much, considering the distance he was going.
column3: He wouldn't cost them much, considering the distance he was going.

column2: Bring me two complete dinners--one Earth-normal and one Mars-normal.
column3: Bring me two complete dinners-one Earth normal and one Mars normal.

column2: Okay, Feldman.	Okay, Feldman.
A sharp click interrupted him.
column3: A sharp click interrupted him.

column2: That's enough, Steward.	That's enough, Steward.
Captain Everts speaking.
column3: Captain Everts speaking.

column2: Dr. Feldman, you have my apologies.
column3: dr Feldman, you have my apologies.

column2: Until you reach your destination, you are my passenger and entitled to every consideration of any other passenger except freedom of movement through the ship.
column3: Until you reach your destination, you are my passenger and entitled to every consideration of any other passenger except freedom of movement through the ship.

column2: I am always available for legitimate complaints."
column3: I am always available for legitimate complaints."

column2: Feldman shook his head.
column3: Feldman shook his head.

column2: He'd heard of such men.
column3: He'd heard of such men.

column2: But he'd thought the species extinct.
column3: But he'd thought the species extinct.

column2: The steward brought his food in a thoroughly chastened manner.
column3: The steward brought his food in a thoroughly chastened manner.

column2: He managed to find space for it and came to attention.
column3: He managed to find space for it and came to attention.

column2: For a moment, as the smell of real steak reached him, Doc regretted the fact that his metabolism had been switched.
column3: For a moment, as the smell of real steak reached him, Doc regretted the fact that his metabolism had been switched.

column2: Then he shrugged.
column3: Then he shrugged.

column2: A little wouldn't hurt him, though there was no proper nourishment in it.
column3: A little wouldn't hurt him, though there was no proper nourishment in it.

column2: He squeezed some of the gravy and bits of meat into one of his bottles, sticking to his purpose; then he fell to on the rest.
column3: He squeezed some of the gravy and bits of meat into one of his bottles, sticking to his purpose; then he fell to on the rest.

column2: But after a few bites, it was queerly unsatisfactory.
column3: But after a few bites, it was queerly unsatisfactory.

column2: The seemingly unappealing Mars-normal ragout suited his current tastes better, after all.
column3: The seemingly unappealing Mars normal ragout suited his current tastes better, after all.

column2: Once the steward had cleared away the dishes, Doc went to work.
column3: Once the steward had cleared away the dishes, Doc went to work.

column2: It was better than wasting his time in dread.
column3: It was better than wasting his time in dread.

column2: He might even be able to leave some notes behind.
column3: He might even be able to leave some notes behind.

column2: A gong sounded, and a red light warned him that acceleration was due.
column3: A gong sounded, and a red light warned him that acceleration was due.

column2: He finished with his bottles, put them into the incubator, and piled into his bunk, swallowing one of the tablets of morphetal the ship furnished.
column3: He finished with his bottles, put them into the incubator, and piled into his bunk, swallowing one of the tablets of morphetal the ship furnished.

column2: Acceleration had ended, and a simple breakfast was waiting when he awoke.
column3: Acceleration had ended, and a simple breakfast was waiting when he awoke.

column2: He flipped the switch while reaching for the coffee.
column3: He flipped the switch while reaching for the coffee.

column2: Captain Everts, the speaker said.
column3: Captain Everts, the speaker said.

column2: Come ahead, Feldman invited.
column3: Come ahead, Feldman invited.

column2: He cut off the switch and glanced at the clock on the wall.
column3: He cut off the switch and glanced at the clock on the wall.

column2: There were less than eleven hours left to him.
column3: There were less than eleven hours left to him.

column2: There was neither friendliness nor hostility in his glance.
column3: There was neither friendliness nor hostility in his glance.

column2: His words were courteous as Doc motioned toward the tray of breakfast.
column3: His words were courteous as Doc motioned toward the tray of breakfast.

column2: I've already eaten, thank you.
column3: I've already eaten, thank you.

column2: He accepted a chair.
column3: He accepted a chair.

column2: His voice was apologetic when he began.
column3: His voice was apologetic when he began.

column2: This is a personal matter which I perhaps have no right to bring up.	This is a personal matter which I perhaps have no right to bring up.
But my wife is greatly worried about this plague.
column3: But my wife is greatly worried about this plague.

column2: The ship physician believes Mrs. Everts may have the plague, but isn't sure of the symptoms.
column3: The ship physician believes mrs Everts may have the plague, but isn't sure of the symptoms.

column2: Doc wondered about the physician.
column3: Doc wondered about the physician.

column2: Apparently there was another man who placed his patients above anything else, though he was probably meticulous about obeying all actual rules.
column3: Apparently there was another man who placed his patients above anything else, though he was probably meticulous about obeying all actual rules.

column2: There was no law against listening to a pariah, at least.
column3: There was no law against listening to a pariah, at least.

column2: When did she have Selznik's migraine? he asked.
column3: When did she have Selznik's migraine? he asked.

column2: We went through it together, shortly after having our metabolism switched during the food shortage of '88."
column3: We went through it together, shortly after having our metabolism switched during the food shortage of 'eighty eight."

I'm sorry."

column2: But Everts wasn't the sort to dicker even for his life.
column3: But Everts wasn't the sort to dicker even for his life.

column2: Nothing that I've found, Captain.	Nothing that I've found, Captain.
I have a clue, but I'm still working on it.

column2: But thank you." He got to his feet and left as quietly and erectly as he had entered.
column3: But thank you." He got to his feet and left as quietly and erectly as he had entered.

column2: He paced his cabin slowly, reading out the hours while his eyes lingered on the little bottle of cultures.
column3: He paced his cabin slowly, reading out the hours while his eyes lingered on the little bottle of cultures.

column3: There was half an hour left when he began opening the little bottles and making his films.

column3: One of them, dressed in a spacesuit, held out another suit to him.

column2: Doc forced his hands to steadiness with foolish pride and began climbing into the suit.
column3: Doc forced his hands to steadiness with foolish pride and began climbing into the suit.

column3: He reached for the helmet, but the man shook his head, pointing to the oxygen gauge.

column2: There would be exactly one hour's supply of oxygen when he was thrown out and it still lacked five minutes of the deadline.
column3: There would be exactly one hour's supply of oxygen when he was thrown out and it still lacked five minutes of the deadline.

column2: The spacesuited man climbed into it and began strapping down so that the rush of air would not sweep him outward when the other seal was released.

column2: Doc had saved one bracky weed.

column2: Now he raised it to his lips, fumbling for a light.
column3: Now he raised it to his lips, fumbling for a light.

column3: Everts stepped forward and flipped a lighter.

column3: Then he caught himself.

column2: Better change your metabolism back to Earth-normal, Captain Everts, he said, and his voice was so normal that he hardly recognized it.
column3: Better change your metabolism back to Earth normal, Captain Everts, he said, and his voice was so normal that he hardly recognized it.

column3: Everts' eyes widened briefly.

column2: The man bowed faintly.
column3: The man bowed faintly.

column2: Thank you, Dr. Feldman.
column3: Thank you, dr Feldman.

column2: It was ridiculous, impossible, and yet there was a curious relief at the formality of it.
column3: It was ridiculous, impossible, and yet there was a curious relief at the formality of it.

column2: It was like something from a play, too unreal to affect his life.
column3: It was like something from a play, too unreal to affect his life.

column3: Doc dropped his bracky weed and felt the helmet snap down.

column2: A hiss of oxygen reached him and the suit ballooned out.
column3: A hiss of oxygen reached him and the suit ballooned out.

column2: There was no gravity; the two men handed him up easily to the one in the airlock while the inner seal began to close.
column3: There was no gravity; the two men handed him up easily to the one in the airlock while the inner seal began to close.

column2: There was still ten seconds to go, according to the big chronometer that had been installed in the lock.
column3: There was still ten seconds to go, according to the big chronometer that had been installed in the lock.

column3: The spaceman's face swung around in surprise.
